Sequence Information.Peptide Name: 2F-Kn2-5R-NH2 (BmKn2 analog, 2F+ Kn2-5R-NH2, synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich; Phe-rich; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (86.67%) toBmKn2-7R or Kn2-5R-NH2R: 33%, F: 27%, I: 20%.Activity: active against multiple clinical Salmonella strains (MIC 4-8 uM). MBC values are identical, indicating bactericidal. Showed an effect on biofilms:bacteria as well. Warning: Other bacteria not tested.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: HC50 5.6 uM, highly hemolytic.SAR: The addition of a pair of hydrophobic FF to the N-terminus made the optimized peptide highly hemolytic.
Literature Information.Author: Mangmee S, Reamtong O, Kalambaheti T, Roytrakul S, Sonthayanon P. 2021
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial Peptide Modifications against Clinically Isolated Antibiotic-Resistant Salmonella.
